questions.answer_description:
Box 1: HR-%RAND:4%
Create a provisioning package for new computers in the HR department.
The naming convention for the computers is the department acronym, followed by a hyphen, and then four numbers, for example, FIN-6785.
Box 2: OU=Computers, OU=HR, DC=Contoso, DC=com
Each department has an organizational unit (OU) that contains a child OU named Computers. Each computer account is in the Computers OU of its respective department.
AccountOU:
Enter the full path for the organizational unit. For example: OU=testOU,DC=domain,DC=Domain,DC=com.
Name of organizational unit for the computer account
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/configuration/wcd/wcd-accounts

discussion.content: The answers provided are correct. I got this question on a KAPLAN practice test.
Answer is correct
Correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to meet the technical requirements for the new HR department computers.
How should you configure the provisioning package? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

You need to prepare for the deployment of the Phoenix office computers.
What should you do first?

choices.C: Extract the serial number information of each computer to a CSV file and upload the file from the Microsoft Endpoint Management admin center.
choices.B: Extract the serial number information of each computer to a XML file and upload the file from the Microsoft Endpoint Management admin center.
choices.D: Generalize the computers and configure the Device settings from the Azure Active Directory admin center.
choices.A: Extract the hardware ID information of each computer to a CSV file and upload the file from the Microsoft Endpoint Management admin center.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer provided (A) is wrong. This has nothing to do with hardware ID (don't confuse it with hardware hash).
You have to Extract the serial number. It's there on their own link:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-store/add-profile-to-devices#add-devices-and-apply-autopilot-deployment-profile

Selected Answer: A
Hardware ID, not the serial number.

Selected Answer: C
Serial number and Hardware Hash, not Hardware ID.

You have to Extract the serial number.
C

Selected Answer: A
A - as per step1:

Successful registration requires that two processes are complete:

1. The device's unique hardware identity (known as a hardware hash) is captured and uploaded to the Autopilot service.
2. The device is associated to an Azure tenant ID.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/registration-overview

comments.content: Disregard, Didn't realize the same question was repeated underneath with a didn't answer.

discussion.content:
I Agree with C but i'm not certain.

I looked this question up on other dumps and most of them said D Generalize the computers and configure the Mobility (MDM and MAM) settings from the Azure Active Directory admin center.

Any Feedback as to why that may be incorrect?

comments.content: The Serial # extracted into a csv file from the machines in this manner is the Hardware ID

discussion.content:
I would go with A here, as the Seril Number is indeed a part of the csv file being generated when you run the PowerShell command to do so on the machine. However, this information is hashed and is reffered to as the Hardware ID.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/add-devices
"You can perform Windows Autopilot device registration within your organization by manually collecting the hardware identity of devices (hardware hashes) and uploading this information in a comma-separated-values (CSV) file. Capturing the hardware hash for manual registration requires booting the device into Windows. So, this process is primarily for testing and evaluation scenarios.
"

Selected Answer: C
CCCCCCCCCCC

Selected Answer: C
Bad question.
Neither is complete and correct. You need the serial number and the hardware hash.
But, as RodrigoT said, C comes close.
Correct

questions.answer_description:
Windows Autopilot Deployment for existing devices.
Configure the Enrollment Status Page.
If you want, you can set up an enrollment status page for Autopilot using Intune.
To enable and configure the enrollment and status page:
1. Open Intune in the Azure portal.
2. Access Intune > Device enrollment > Windows enrollment and Set up an enrollment status page.
3. Access Azure Active Directory > Mobility (MDM and MAM) > Microsoft Intune and Configure automatic MDM enrollment and configure the MDM user scope for some or all users.
Note:
Provide new computers to the Phoenix office users. The new computers have Windows 10 Pro preinstalled and were purchased already.
Deploy Windows 10 Enterprise to the computers of the Phoenix office users by using Windows Autopilot.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-store/add-profile-to-devices https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/windows-autopilot/existing-devices

choices.D: Extract the serial number information of each computer to a CSV file and upload the file from the Microsoft Intune blade in the Azure portal.
choices.B: Extract the hardware ID information of each computer to a CSV file and upload the file from the Microsoft Intune blade in the Azure portal.
choices.A: Generalize the computers and configure the Mobility (MDM and MAM) settings from the Azure Active Directory admin center.
choices.C: Extract the hardware ID information of each computer to an XML file and upload the file from the Devices settings in Microsoft Store for Business.

discussion.content: Extract the hardware ID Information of each Computer to CVS file

Selected Answer: B
it should be b. deploy by using autopilot
TRASH, please remove.
Hoekom

This question is so outdated. It's impossible to do any of these under Azure portal. You have to use Endpoint for everything. B and C are totally wrong. I would vote for D if it was under Endpoint. 
A. could be the first step, also under Endpoint, but, generalize new computers just bough? Why? We are using Autopilot, not deploying images.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/existing-devices#procedures

questions.question_text:
You need to prepare for the deployment of the Phoenix office computers.
What should you do first?

HOTSPOT -
You need to meet the technical requirements for Windows Autopilot.
Which two settings should you configure from the Azure Active Directory blade? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Devices -
Note: Deploy Windows 10 Enterprise to the computers of the Phoenix office users by using Windows Autopilot.

Configure device settings -
If you want to manage device identities by using the Azure portal, the devices need to be either registered or joined to Azure AD. As an administrator, you can control the process of registering and joining devices by configuring device settings.
Box 2: Mobility (MDM and MAM)
Windows Autopilot Deployment for existing devices.
Configure the Enrollment Status Page.
If you want, you can set up an enrollment status page for Autopilot using Intune.
To enable and configure the enrollment and status page:
1) Open Intune in the Azure portal.
2) Access Intune > Device enrollment > Windows enrollment and Set up an enrollment status page.
3) Access Azure Active Directory > Mobility (MDM and MAM) > Microsoft Intune and Configure automatic MDM enrollment and configure the MDM user scope for some or all users.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/devices/device-management-azure-portal#configure-device-settings https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/existing-devices

discussion.content:
Since Configure the Enrollment Status Page (MDM and MAM) is optional, yes, check here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/existing-devices#configure-the-enrollment-status-page-optional
I would go for Users and Devices. These are mandatory steps explained in this walkthrough video on this link:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/autopilot/configuration-requirements
I see now, it says "Most of the phoenix users work from home" which brings in mobility and devices is where you do autopilot things.
Users and Devices was my choice.
